transcript.text: What kind of information do you need to keep confidential? Here are some examples, although there are other types of confidential information not listed here. Click on each heading to confirm your understanding.

contentText.text: Confidential information can take many forms. It can be written down, communicated verbally or stored in a database. What matters is the content that is being communicated.

instructionText.text: Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

tabText.text: Protect any forward-looking information about our business. If competitors learn what we are planning, it could give them a significant advantage.

Treat any non-public information about Johnson Controls' financial performance or pricing as confidential. This includes information about potential acquisitions. Our company must follow strict rules in how we release and share financial information, since it can change how investors view the company.

Protect customer lists, customer agreements, market share data, supplier agreements and similar information. These contain significant inside knowledge of our business and, if someone else learned them, it could compromise our competitive advantages.
Our value as a company comes from our products and know-how. Software source code, product drawings, technical manuals and research and development materials must be carefully guarded.
